text: Bengaluru city railway station saw tensions rise when activists protested the alleged transportation of dog meat. However, food safety officials confirmed the 2,700kg shipment from Jaipur contained goat meat. The police filed three FIRs related to the incident, clarifying that the meat was a special breed of goat, not dog meat as suspected by activists.

text: India's cement industry is witnessing an intense battle as Gautam Adani's expansion efforts trigger a race with Kumar Mangalam Birla's UltraTech Cement Ltd. Both billionaires are striving to dominate the supply of cement, crucial for India's infrastructure boom. In less than two years, Adani and UltraTech have completed six deals, with UltraTech announcing a seventh acquisition of a key regional player.

text: Kumar Mangalam Birla cemented his position as India's top building materials maker by acquiring N Srinivasan's cement business for Rs 3,954 crore. UltraTech Cement's move includes a 33% stake in India Cements. This deal, pending regulatory approval, aims to expand UltraTech's reach in southern India, especially Tamil Nadu, enhancing its capacity and market presence.
title: UltraTech to buy Srinivasan stake in India Cements

text: The government monitored top 20 insolvency cases under Insolvency & Bankruptcy Code (IBC) due to slow action taken by banks. Following the intervention, movements in Jaiprakash Associates and Amtek Auto were observed. Bankers were found discussing loan settlements despite ongoing IBC issues. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman reviewed multiple cases to expedite the process and improve debt recovery mechanisms.
title: Banks told to speed up IBC resolutions

text: N Srinivasan may now focus primarily on cricket, as his family's control over Chennai Super Kings Cricket remains unaffected despite Ultratech Cements acquiring a majority stake in India Cements. The Srinivasan family owns a significant portion of CSKCL, ensuring their continued leadership. CSKCL posted a 65% profit growth in FY23, generating Rs 52.2 crore in net profit.

text: The finance ministry clarified that amendments to the Black Money Act would not require all residents traveling overseas to obtain a tax clearance certificate. Only those facing investigations or with tax arrears over Rs 10 lakh would need such certification, issued by senior officials, as per Section 230 of the Income-tax Act.
title: Tax clearance certificate not needed for all

text: Private banks in Mumbai faced new liquidity coverage norms from RBI, requiring stable funds like fixed deposits and increased investment in govt securities. The norms pressured interest margins and saw a significant drop in liquidity coverage ratios (LCR) for both private and public sector banks, impacting digital banking accounts and collateral valuation.

text: UltraTech Cement has agreed to acquire a 32.72% stake in India Cements for Rs 3,954 crore. This move, raising UltraTech's total stake to over 55%, aims to boost its market presence in southern India. The acquisition supports UltraTech’s broader strategy of dominating the Indian cement market. Completion is pending regulatory approvals and is expected within six months.
title: UltraTech Cement to acquire majority stake in India Cements

text: The Reserve Bank of India has fined Visa Worldwide, Ola Financial Services, and Manappuram Finance for failing to comply with regulatory requirements. text: Former India head coach Rahul Dravid defended the T20 World Cup's US leg, arguing that playing at odd hours and adjusting to challenging facilities were necessary compromises to popularize cricket globally. He emphasized the importance of such events and praised the organization behind the initiative despite the controversial 10:30 a.m. start times and infrastructural issues. Dravid praised the government for its bold decision to bring the World Cup to the United States while speaking with ICC CEO Geoff Allardice.
title: 'If you want to grow the sport...': Dravid defends US leg of T20 WC

text: India, under coach Gautam Gambhir and captain Suryakumar Yadav, secured the T20I series against Sri Lanka with dominant performances in the first two matches. With the final match approaching, India aim to complete a clean sweep, while Sri Lanka struggle with middle-order collapses and seeks to salvage some pride.

text: Washington Freedom won the MLC 2024 trophy by defeating San Francisco Unicorns by 96 runs at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas. Skipper Steven Smith’s 88 and Glenn Maxwell’s 40 helped set a massive 207/5. Marco Jansen and Rachin Ravindra took 3 wickets each, limiting Unicorns to 111 in 16 overs, securing a dominant victory.
title: Washington Freedom beat San Francisco Unicorns to win MLC title

text: Suryakumar Yadav expressed his joy over his memorable catch in the ICC T20 World Cup final against South Africa, which helped India win their second title after 11 years. The match saw significant contributions from Virat Kohli and Hardik Pandya, leading India to a seven-run victory and ending their trophy drought since 2013.
title: Watch: SKY talks about his T20 WC winning catch against SA

text: Suryakumar received the Fielder Medal of the Match in the T20 World Cup 2024 final after making a stunning catch at long-off to remove David Miller. Miller's dismissal helped India make a comeback and secure the crucial win by seven runs. Needing 16 runs from the final over, South Africa had the big-hitting David Miller on strike. He hit a wide full toss from Hardik Pandya, but Suryakumar steadied himself on the ropes, caught the ball, released it just as he went over the boundary ropes, and then came back in to complete an astonishing catch.
title: Rohit pulls off Suryakumar Yadav-like heart-stopping catch

text: The Indian cricket team's participation in the ICC Champions Trophy in Pakistan is a contentious issue due to the country's long-standing stance not to travel there. Former cricketers from both nations have raised concerns about the visit, with ex-Pakistan pacer Tanvir Ahmed referring to Pakistan's visit to India for the ODI World Cup last year.

text: Ravichandran Ashwin was involved in a humorous incident during a TNPL 2024 match. Bowler Mohan Prasath warned Ashwin for leaving the non-striker's end too early, but he kept his bat grounded until the last moment. The incident amused both spectators and commentators, as commentators couldn't contain their laughter during the on-air commentary.

text: Sri Lanka's women's cricket team secured their maiden Asia Cup title with an impressive eight-wicket victory over India. Chasing 166, Sri Lanka's innings was anchored by Chamari Athapaththu's 61 off 43 and Harshitha Samarawickrama's 69 not out off 51. Their 87-run partnership, followed by a 73-run stand between Samarawickrama and Kavisha Dilhari, sealed the win with nine balls to spare. India's 165/6 was led by Smriti Mandhana's 60, but Sri Lanka's disciplined bowling proved decisive.
title: Sri Lanka beat India to lift maiden women's Asia Cup title

text: England achieved a dominant 10-wicket victory over West Indies in the third Test at Edgbaston, completing a 3-0 series sweep. England chased the target of 82 runs in just 7.2 overs, finishing at 87-0. Captain Ben Stokes set a record for the fastest fifty by an England player in Test cricket, reaching it in 24 balls. Mark Wood's exceptional bowling, with figures of 5-40, dismantled the West Indies, who were bowled out for 175 in their second innings.
title: Stokes-led England complete 3-0 series sweep against Windies

text: Axar Patel praised new T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav for his supportive leadership during India's 43-run victory over Sri Lanka. text: The CBI filed a chargesheet against Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal in the excise policy case. Kejriwal remains in judicial custody till August 8. The Delhi high court will review his bail plea on Monday. Additionally, the Enforcement Directorate accused Kejriwal and the Aam Aadmi Party in a money laundering case related to the now-scrapped liquor policy.
title: CBI files chargesheet against CM Arvind Kejriwal in Delhi excise policy case

text: Three UPSC aspirants died after the basement of Rau's IAS Study Circle in Delhi flooded due to heavy rain. Students protested safety violations and negligence by the Delhi government. The Civic body staff had not addressed their demands. Police arrested the coaching center's owner and coordinator, and the Municipal Corporation of Delhi sealed 13 coaching centers for flouting norms.

text: Early Monday morning, a fire at a south Delhi restaurant in INA market injured six people and spread to two nearby fast food joints. The blaze, reported at 3:18am, was controlled within two hours by seven fire tenders. The injured were taken to AIIMS and Safdarjung Hospital. A short circuit is suspected to have caused the fire.
title: Delhi: 6 injured in INA market restaurant blaze

text: Delhi Police arrested Abhishek Gupta, CEO of Rau's IAS Study Circle, and coordinator Deshpal Singh after three students drowned in the institute's flooded basement. The basement lacked a drainage system and necessary clearances. Initial reports suggest water entered when an SUV sped past the flooded road. Police will record statements from rescued students to determine events.
title: Delhi coaching centre tragedy: Rau’s IAS Study Circle CEO, aide held

text: A magisterial inquiry revealed that a damaged wire from a submersible pump caused the electrocution of civil services aspirant Nilesh Rai in South Patel Nagar. Rai accidentally touched an iron gate with exposed wires during heavy rainfall, leading to his death. The inquiry suggested electrical audits for buildings to prevent future incidents.
title: Probe finds faulty wiring led to UPSC aspirant’s electrocution

text: New Delhi experienced high-intensity, hyper-local rainfall on Saturday, leading to flooding in Old Rajender Nagar. Pusa recorded 58mm of rain, while other areas saw minimal or no rainfall. Three IAS aspirants died due to waterlogging. IMD officials provided explanations, with forecasts predicting more rain on Tuesday and Wednesday.
title: Delhi coaching centre tragedy: How hyper-local rain wreaked havoc in Old Rajender Nagar

text: Over 400 students protested in Karol Bagh and Old Rajender Nagar, demanding justice and accountability from authorities. Issues raised included infrastructure failures, desilting sewage lines, and safety concerns. The protest escalated, leading to clashes with police and mild force being used. Authorities were urged to investigate the cause of the infrastructure problems.
title: Delhi coaching centre tragedy: Students protest for justice and better infrastructure

text: Abhishek Gupta, CEO of Rau's IAS Study Circle, was arrested following the drowning of three students in a flooded basement without proper drainage or clearances. The basement, intended for storage, was illegally used as a library. Emergency services conducted rescue operations, recovering the deceased. Authorities are investigating clearances and code violations.
title: Delhi coaching centre tragedy: 'Basement was misused as library, safety norms were violated'

text: The Union Ministry of Education celebrates the 4th anniversary of the National Education Policy 2020 with the "Shiksha Saptah" campaign. Schools nationwide will enhance community involvement through initiatives like Vidyanjali, a volunteer program, and Tithi Bhojan. Activities include onboarding volunteers, gratitude letters, and community awareness events, aligning with NEP 2020's goal of increased community participation in education.
title: 'Shiksha Saptah' campaign launched by Education Ministry to celebrate NEP 2020 4th anniversary

text: Utkal University faced severe faculty shortages, with 75% of professor posts vacant. This significantly impacted education quality and research output. Temporary solutions included hiring guest faculty. A long-pending court case stalled new faculty recruitment, but academicians hoped the issue would resolve soon with government intervention. The vice-chancellor emphasized state government involvement for permanent solutions.

text: Several IITs have abolished the option for first-year students to change their core branches, aiming to reduce academic pressure. This decision, followed by IITs like Madras, Kharagpur, and others, seeks to ensure a balanced student experience without the stress of maintaining high CGPA for a branch change. The move has sparked diverse opinions on its impact on student well-being.

text: Kyrgyzstan approved a deal with Russia to clean up radioactive sites from Soviet-era mining to ensure public safety. The removal of 55 tonnes of toxic rocket fuel near Bishkek further reduces environmental risks. Rosatom, along with EU and World Bank backing, supports these efforts.

text: Brazil's federal workers' strike impacts Amazon protection and oil permitting. A planned slowdown will extend until COP30 in Belem, 2025. Petrobras faces a 200,000 barrels/day loss. text: University of Delaware and Argonne scientists, led by Kayser and Kaphan, converted Styrofoam to PEDOT: PSS using 1,3-Disulfonic acid imidazolium chloride. They optimized reactions using various conditions, verified by X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy. Their eco-friendly polymer matched commercial equivalents, using stoichiometric ratios, offering broader sustainability applications.

text: UP CM Adityanath announced planting 36 crore saplings for PM Modi's World Environment Day campaign. Floods impacted 24 districts, temperatures hit 47-50 degrees. 25,000 farmers benefit from BJP's seven-year, 168 crore saplings effort with a 200 crore grant. text: As global temperatures rise, melting ice sheets at Earth's poles are lengthening the planet's day at an unprecedented rate, a new study reveals. This phenomenon, driven by climate change-induced sea-level rise, alters Earth's shape and slows its rotation. Researchers warn that if emissions persist, the increase in day length could more than double by the century's end, underscoring the profound impact of climate change on planetary dynamics.
title: Melting ice sheets lengthen Earth's days at unprecedented rate, Nasa study finds

text: Authorities warn of severe water shortages in Greece following the warmest winter and earliest heatwave on record. The Mornos reservoir's levels have dropped 30 percent. Athens, home to 3.7 million people, is on "yellow alert" to reduce water consumption. The influx of tourists, poor management, and climate change exacerbate the crisis.

The delayed formation of La Nina and a neutral Indian Ocean Dipole impacted monsoon conditions. Last year, the region saw surplus rainfall, highlighting the erratic weather patterns possibly tied to climate change and affecting farmers reliant on monsoon rains.

Residents also confirmed widespread illnesses despite precautions.

text: A 35-year-old man, Manvir, was found dead on the Sohna-Palwal road on Saturday with facial injuries. Police are investigating whether the death was accidental or a murder. text: A 50-year-old private company employee died and his daughter was injured after their auto-rickshaw overturned on the Gurgaon-Delhi Expressway. The driver fled the scene, and police have registered a case against him. The incident happened near Beriwala Bagh, and the victims were taken to Medanta Hospital, where the father was declared dead.

text: The Supreme Court directed Haryana to provide details of affordable housing projects issued in the last decade. The court sought information on licensing, costs, agreements, layouts, project completion, monitoring mechanisms, and violations.

text: Residents of DLF Hamilton Court in Gurgaon raised concerns over illegal shops operating near their society without necessary approvals. text: The Congress party urged accountability after three IAS aspirants died due to waterlogging in a coaching center basement in Delhi's Old Rajinder Nagar. Rahul Gandhi, Mallikarjun Kharge, and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra condemned the negligence and called for rectification of dangerous constructions. The Delhi Police arrested the coaching center's owner and coordinator for culpable homicide.

text: In West Delhi's Old Rajender Nagar, students protested after three died in a flooded coaching institute's basement. They criticized the MCD and the coaching center for negligence. Authorities have initiated a criminal investigation, recovering three bodies and rescuing several students. The incident prompted calls for stricter safety measures and accountability for the deaths.

text: Three individuals, including a bank employee, were arrested for allegedly defrauding people through fake job offers. The accused, Jitendra Patel, Ashish Jain, and Utsav Chaturvedi, lured victims with promises of paid hotel reviews. A complaint was filed when a victim realized he couldn't withdraw his deposited money after following instructions from 'Ishika Reddy'. Further investigation revealed Utsav Chaturvedi, an assistant manager at ICICI Bank, had helped open the fraudulent account. This case adds to the 17 bank employees already arrested in Gurgaon for cyber fraud.

text: Doctors in Gurgaon expressed concerns over the rising trend of jawline correction surgery, warning of potential risks such as asymmetry, bleeding, and cardiac issues if not done correctly. Non-surgical alternatives like dermal fillers offer immediate results. Dr. Anmol Chugh and Dr. Adhishwar Sharma emphasized the importance of choosing certified plastic surgeons and using FDA-approved products. Post-procedure care is crucial, including avoiding smoking and heavy exercise. Prices for fillers range from Rs 25,000 to Rs 35,000 per millilitre, while surgical procedures can cost between Rs 1 lakh to Rs 3 lakh.
title: Is jawline correction surgery right choice for you? Expert opinions from Gurgaon doctors

text: Gurgaon experienced a brief spell of rain on Saturday evening, with the maximum temperature rising to 36.6 degrees Celsius. text: The Gurgaon Municipal Corporation (MCG) issued notices to 200 bulk waste generators (BWGs) for not complying with the Solid Waste Management Rules, 2016. MCG fined 45 BWGs for violations. New guidelines now classify generators of 100kg or more waste daily as BWGs. The city has 8,749 BWGs, which must manage waste independently to reduce landfill use.

text: The Haryana Police's Special Task Force arrested gangster Rohit at IGI airport. A close aide to Kala Khairampuriya, Rohit was involved in a shooting at a car dealership in Hisar, where Rs 5 crore was demanded as 'protection money'. This arrest marks the fifth gangster from the Kala Khairampuriya gang to be apprehended in the last five years. An Interpol notice led to his deportation from Thailand. Rohit was remanded in custody to aid the ongoing investigation into the gang's operations.

text: Residents of BPTP Township in Sector 37D protested after a five-year-old boy drowned in a swimming pool. text: Illegal farmhouses in Gurgaon’s Ansals Aravali Retreat were demolished by the district administration, but reconstruction began promptly. text: The government monitored top 20 insolvency cases under Insolvency & Bankruptcy Code (IBC) due to slow action taken by banks. text: Kumar Mangalam Birla cemented his position as India's top building materials maker by acquiring N Srinivasan's cement business for Rs 3,954 crore. UltraTech Cement's move includes a 33% stake in India Cements. This deal, pending regulatory approval, aims to expand UltraTech's reach in southern India, especially Tamil Nadu, enhancing its capacity and market presence.
title: UltraTech to buy Srinivasan stake in India Cements

text: Goa has transformed from a laidback haven to a luxury real estate hotspot due to the new Manohar International Airport. text: PM Narendra Modi highlighted community-led efforts in forest and wildlife conservation on World Nature Conservation Day, mentioning campaigns like Rajasthan’s 'Kulhadi Band Panchayat'. He emphasized initiatives like 'Baagh Mitra Karyakram' in UP and the engagement of tribes in Maharashtra and Andhra Pradesh, underlining their role in boosting India's tiger population, which makes up 70% of the world’s total.
title: Community-led efforts key to tiger conservation: PM Modi

text: Tadoba witnessed an incredible sight with three generations of tigers, highlighting India's Project Tiger success. Junabai, her cub Veera, and Veera's cubs were spotted. This is a testament to India's efforts in wildlife conservation, leading to a 24% increase in the tiger population from 2018 to 2022, now home to 3,682 tigers.
title: 'Tiger's future hinges on us. It's a collective responsibility': Sachin Tendulkar

text: President Droupadi Murmu appointed new governors to nine states, reassigning several BJP and RSS veterans.
